page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY-AIR MUSEUM
page.content: The Notts and Lincs Air{Museum} stands in a corner of Winthorpe Airfield. Exhibits include a range of 33{ {aircraft},one a Vulcan bomber recently withdrawn from service.They are owned variously by the Museum Society and by private individuals.A range of smaller items of equipment and memorabilia,many found locally,is also on display. Maintenance and development work is done voluntarily by members who pay an annual fee of Â£6.The youth Training Scheme is also used occasionally.A hangar on the site provides shelter for the work and for delicate,fabric_ covered aircraft. The Museum opens all week from April to October,to cater for school parties,and on Sundays only, during winter months.There were 20,330{ {visitors}in 1984.
